title: Tata Communications wins digital transformation deal from Tata Motors-owned JLR
description: ​​​The deal will power the production of JLR’s next-generation vehicles, a key part of its Reimagine strategy, and provide the connectivity foundation for the next phase of digital transformation for the organisation.
content: Tata Communications said on Tuesday that it has won a digital transformation deal from Tata Motors-owned British automaker JLR. Deal financials were not disclosed. The deal will power the production of JLR’s next-generation vehicles, a key part of its Reimagine strategy, and provide the connectivity foundation for the next phase of digital transformation for the organisation. Tata Communications has already commenced implementation of the network transformation program and will complete the deployment by 2025. Earlier, in September, Tata Consultancy Services had announced that it had won a deal with the Digital unit of JLR in a deal valued at £800 million over the next five years to support JLR’s Rimagine strategy. Tata Communications will deploy its cloud-first, software-defined wide area network (SD-WAN) technology, connecting all of JLR’s 128 sites worldwide. This globally connected capability — between JLR’s global HQ and its plants, warehouses, sales centers, data centers, and cloud services, will boost supply chain efficiency and security.
